docs.title: All you need is documentation

docs.text: NEW COMMAND: 𝑔𝑒𝑑𝑖𝑡 – opens files in a more comfortable user interface. For example: 𝑔𝑒𝑑𝑖𝑡 ~/.𝑏𝑎𝑠ℎ𝑟𝑐 . TODO: talk about bashrc, how to change terminal command line design.
docs.title: Linux

docs.text: Start to use ROS2 Before getting started, please follow the steps in setup section . Let your shell know about ROS: ROS installation folder is /𝑜𝑝𝑡/𝑟𝑜𝑠/ℎ𝑢𝑚𝑏𝑙𝑒/𝑠𝑒𝑡𝑢𝑝.𝑏𝑎𝑠ℎ . In order to use ROS you have to run: 𝑠𝑜𝑢𝑟𝑐𝑒 /𝑜𝑝𝑡/𝑟𝑜𝑠/ℎ𝑢𝑚𝑏𝑙𝑒/𝑠𝑒𝑡𝑢𝑝.𝑏𝑎𝑠ℎ . It configures your shell so that it can find ROS programs and lets those programs find the required ROS packages. To avoid running this command again in any new terminal, add this command into ~/.𝑏𝑎𝑠ℎ𝑟𝑐 .
docs.title: Create Worksapce

docs.text: Before getting started, please follow the steps in setup section .
docs.title: Start to use ROS2

docs.text: ROS installation folder is /𝑜𝑝𝑡/𝑟𝑜𝑠/ℎ𝑢𝑚𝑏𝑙𝑒/𝑠𝑒𝑡𝑢𝑝.𝑏𝑎𝑠ℎ . In order to use ROS you have to run: 𝑠𝑜𝑢𝑟𝑐𝑒 /𝑜𝑝𝑡/𝑟𝑜𝑠/ℎ𝑢𝑚𝑏𝑙𝑒/𝑠𝑒𝑡𝑢𝑝.𝑏𝑎𝑠ℎ . It configures your shell so that it can find ROS programs and lets those programs find the required ROS packages. To avoid running this command again in any new terminal, add this command into ~/.𝑏𝑎𝑠ℎ𝑟𝑐 .
docs.title: Let your shell know about ROS:

docs.text: Install ROS2 and Setup Your Environment: I assume you have a virtual machine with Linux distribution on it (like Ubuntu). 𝑠𝑢𝑑𝑜 𝑎𝑝𝑡 𝑢𝑝𝑑𝑎𝑡𝑒 𝑠𝑢𝑑𝑜 𝑎𝑝𝑡 𝑢𝑝𝑔𝑟𝑎𝑑𝑒 𝑠𝑢𝑑𝑜 𝑎𝑝𝑡 𝑎𝑢𝑡𝑜𝑟𝑒𝑚𝑜𝑣𝑒 to make sure your system is up to date. Terminator 𝑠𝑢𝑑𝑜 𝑎𝑝𝑡 𝑖𝑛𝑠𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑙 𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑚𝑖𝑛𝑎𝑡𝑜𝑟 VS-code: Add three main extensions – C/C++, CMake, Python. Make sure you have python installed: 𝑠𝑢𝑑𝑜 𝑎𝑝𝑡 𝑖𝑛𝑠𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑙 𝑝𝑦𝑡ℎ𝑜𝑛3−𝑝𝑖𝑝
docs.title: Setup

docs.text: I assume you have a virtual machine with Linux distribution on it (like Ubuntu). 𝑠𝑢𝑑𝑜 𝑎𝑝𝑡 𝑢𝑝𝑑𝑎𝑡𝑒 𝑠𝑢𝑑𝑜 𝑎𝑝𝑡 𝑢𝑝𝑔𝑟𝑎𝑑𝑒 𝑠𝑢𝑑𝑜 𝑎𝑝𝑡 𝑎𝑢𝑡𝑜𝑟𝑒𝑚𝑜𝑣𝑒 to make sure your system is up to date.
